title: R. Nicholas Burns - Wikipedia
snippet: Robert Nicholas Burns (born January 28, 1956) is an American diplomat and international relations scholar. He served as the United States ambassador to China from 2022 to 2025. He is now Roy and Barbara Goodman Family Professor of the Practice of Diplomacy and International Relations at Harvard ...

title: R. Nicholas Burns
snippet: R. Nicholas Burns (born January 28, 1956) is an American career diplomat who served as the United States Ambassador to the People's Republic of China from 2022 to 2025.[1][2] Over a 27-year tenure in the U.S. Foreign Service spanning six presidents, ...

title: Ambassador Nicholas Burns to Rejoin The Cohen Group as a Vice Chair | The Cohen Group
snippet: Ambassador Nicholas Burns will return to The Cohen Group following his service as US Ambassador to China from 2021 to early 2025, the firm announced today.

title: Former U.S. Ambassador to China To Return to Kennedy School Professorship | News | The Harvard Crimson
snippet: Nicholas Burns will return to the Harvard Kennedy School as a professor this April, joining the Fairbank Center for Chinese Studies, the University announced earlier this week.
